title: Business Data Scientist, Ads Marketing Technology

description:
Minimum qualifications:
• Master's degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Bioinformatics, Economics, a related field, or equivalent practical experience.
• 1 year of experience in a data science field.
• Experience with statistical software (e.g., R, Python, MATLAB) and database languages (i.e. SQL).

Preferred qualifications:
• 1 year of experience with statistical data analysis such as generalized linear models, multivariate analysis, clustering/segmentation, and sampling methods.
• Experience leveraging data insights into storytelling for business stakeholders.
• Experience in controlled experiment design and causal inference methods.
• Experience with machine learning on large-scale computing systems like Hadoop, MapReduce, or similar environments.
• Ability to convince business stakeholders and communicate complex analysis insights to non-technical audiences.
• Excellent communication and people skills.

About the job

The Ads Marketing Technology team is a multidisciplinary group of engineers, data scientists, designers, product, and marketing leaders within Google Ads.

Our mission is critical to Google Ads growth with a goal to create great user experiences for small businesses working with Google Ads. With a global footprint of growth programs, we engage advertisers and agencies of all sizes. We build the tools, infrastructure and user experiences to drive new customer acquisition, product adoption, and business growth for Google's advertising business.

Know the user. Know the magic. Connect the two. At its core, marketing at Google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. Our job is to demonstrate how Google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. And we approach marketing in a way that only Google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself.

The US base salary range for this full-time position is $105,000-$152,000 bonus equity benefits. Our salary ranges are determined by role, level, and location. The range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Within the range, individual pay is determined by work location and additional factors, including job-related skills, experience, and relevant education or training. Your recruiter can share more about the specific salary range for your preferred location during the hiring process.

Please note that the compensation details listed in US role postings reflect the base salary only, and do not include bonus, equity, or benefits. Learn more about benefits at Google .

Responsibilities
• Work with large, complex data sets and solve complex analysis problems, applying advanced analytical methods (such as statistical and machine learning models) as needed. Conduct analysis that includes problem formulation, data gathering and requirements specification, processing, analysis, ongoing deliverables, and presentations.
• Design and analyze controlled experiments or counterfactual causal inference studies to examine the impact of Ads marketing programs.
• Build and prototype analysis pipelines iteratively to provide insights at scale. Develop comprehensive knowledge of Google data structures and metrics, advocating for changes where needed.
• Develop and automate reports, iteratively build and prototype dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for business priorities.
